summary: Mary Magdalene was a follower of Jesus, mentioned often in the Bible. She was there when Jesus was crucified and the first to see him after his resurrection. Mary likely came from Magdala, a town near the Sea of Galilee. She was wealthy and helped fund Jesus' ministry. The Bible says seven evil spirits were driven out of her. Many Christian churches consider her a saint, and she is known as the "Apostle of the apostles" in Catholicism.
title: Mary Magdalene
